AssociateLenses.name: AssociateLenses
AssociateLenses.documentation:
Associate a lens to a workload.

Up to 10 lenses can be associated with a workload in a single API operation. A maximum of 20 lenses can be associated with a workload.

Disclaimer

By accessing and/or applying custom lenses created by another Amazon Web Services user or account, you acknowledge that custom lenses created by other users and shared with you are Third Party Content as defined in the Amazon Web Services Customer Agreement.

CreateLensShare.name: CreateLensShare
CreateLensShare.documentation:
Create a lens share.

The owner of a lens can share it with other Amazon Web Services accounts, users, an organization, and organizational units (OUs) in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Lenses provided by Amazon Web Services (Amazon Web Services Official Content) cannot be shared.

Shared access to a lens is not removed until the lens invitation is deleted.

If you share a lens with an organization or OU, all accounts in the organization or OU are granted access to the lens.

For more information, see Sharing a custom lens in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.

Disclaimer

By sharing your custom lenses with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your custom lenses available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared custom lenses even if you delete the custom lenses from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

CreateLensVersion.name: CreateLensVersion
CreateLensVersion.documentation:
Create a new lens version.

A lens can have up to 100 versions.

Use this operation to publish a new lens version after you have imported a lens. The LensAlias is used to identify the lens to be published. The owner of a lens can share the lens with other Amazon Web Services accounts and users in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Only the owner of a lens can delete it.

CreateMilestone.name: CreateMilestone
CreateMilestone.documentation: Create a milestone for an existing workload.

CreateReviewTemplate.name: CreateReviewTemplate
CreateReviewTemplate.documentation:
Create a review template.

Disclaimer

Do not include or gather personal identifiable information (PII) of end users or other identifiable individuals in or via your review templates. If your review template or those shared with you and used in your account do include or collect PII you are responsible for: ensuring that the included PII is processed in accordance with applicable law, providing adequate privacy notices, and obtaining necessary consents for processing such data.

CreateTemplateShare.name: CreateTemplateShare
CreateTemplateShare.documentation:
Create a review template share.

The owner of a review template can share it with other Amazon Web Services accounts, users, an organization, and organizational units (OUs) in the same Amazon Web Services Region.

Shared access to a review template is not removed until the review template share invitation is deleted.

If you share a review template with an organization or OU, all accounts in the organization or OU are granted access to the review template.

Disclaimer

By sharing your review template with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your review template available to those other accounts.

CreateWorkload.name: CreateWorkload
CreateWorkload.documentation:
Create a new workload.

The owner of a workload can share the workload with other Amazon Web Services accounts, users, an organization, and organizational units (OUs) in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Only the owner of a workload can delete it.

For more information, see Defining a Workload in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.

Either AwsRegions, NonAwsRegions, or both must be specified when creating a workload.

You also must specify ReviewOwner, even though the parameter is listed as not being required in the following section.

When creating a workload using a review template, you must have the following IAM permissions:

  • wellarchitected:GetReviewTemplate

  • wellarchitected:GetReviewTemplateAnswer

  • wellarchitected:ListReviewTemplateAnswers

  • wellarchitected:GetReviewTemplateLensReview

CreateWorkloadShare.name: CreateWorkloadShare
CreateWorkloadShare.documentation:
Create a workload share.

The owner of a workload can share it with other Amazon Web Services accounts and users in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Shared access to a workload is not removed until the workload invitation is deleted.

If you share a workload with an organization or OU, all accounts in the organization or OU are granted access to the workload.

For more information, see Sharing a workload in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.

DeleteLens.name: DeleteLens
DeleteLens.documentation:
Delete an existing lens.

Only the owner of a lens can delete it. After the lens is deleted, Amazon Web Services accounts and users that you shared the lens with can continue to use it, but they will no longer be able to apply it to new workloads.

Disclaimer

By sharing your custom lenses with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your custom lenses available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared custom lenses even if you delete the custom lenses from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

DeleteLensShare.name: DeleteLensShare
DeleteLensShare.documentation:
Delete a lens share.

After the lens share is deleted, Amazon Web Services accounts, users, organizations, and organizational units (OUs) that you shared the lens with can continue to use it, but they will no longer be able to apply it to new workloads.

Disclaimer

By sharing your custom lenses with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your custom lenses available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared custom lenses even if you delete the custom lenses from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

DeleteProfile.name: DeleteProfile
DeleteProfile.documentation:
Delete a profile.

Disclaimer

By sharing your profile with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your profile available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared profile even if you delete the profile from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

DeleteReviewTemplate.name: DeleteReviewTemplate
DeleteReviewTemplate.documentation:
Delete a review template.

Only the owner of a review template can delete it.

After the review template is deleted, Amazon Web Services accounts, users, organizations, and organizational units (OUs) that you shared the review template with will no longer be able to apply it to new workloads.

DeleteTemplateShare.name: DeleteTemplateShare
DeleteTemplateShare.documentation:
Delete a review template share.

After the review template share is deleted, Amazon Web Services accounts, users, organizations, and organizational units (OUs) that you shared the review template with will no longer be able to apply it to new workloads.

DisassociateLenses.name: DisassociateLenses
DisassociateLenses.documentation:
Disassociate a lens from a workload.

Up to 10 lenses can be disassociated from a workload in a single API operation.

The Amazon Web Services Well-Architected Framework lens (wellarchitected) cannot be removed from a workload.

ExportLens.name: ExportLens
ExportLens.documentation:
Export an existing lens.

Only the owner of a lens can export it. Lenses provided by Amazon Web Services (Amazon Web Services Official Content) cannot be exported.

Lenses are defined in JSON. For more information, see JSON format specification in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.

Disclaimer

Do not include or gather personal identifiable information (PII) of end users or other identifiable individuals in or via your custom lenses. If your custom lens or those shared with you and used in your account do include or collect PII you are responsible for: ensuring that the included PII is processed in accordance with applicable law, providing adequate privacy notices, and obtaining necessary consents for processing such data.

GetAnswer.name: GetAnswer
GetAnswer.documentation: Get the answer to a specific question in a workload review.

GetConsolidatedReport.name: GetConsolidatedReport
GetConsolidatedReport.documentation:
Get a consolidated report of your workloads.

You can optionally choose to include workloads that have been shared with you.

GetMilestone.name: GetMilestone
GetMilestone.documentation: Get a milestone for an existing workload.

GetReviewTemplateLensReview.name: GetReviewTemplateLensReview
GetReviewTemplateLensReview.documentation: Get a lens review associated with a review template.

ImportLens.name: ImportLens
ImportLens.documentation:
Import a new custom lens or update an existing custom lens.

To update an existing custom lens, specify its ARN as the LensAlias. If no ARN is specified, a new custom lens is created.

The new or updated lens will have a status of DRAFT. The lens cannot be applied to workloads or shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts until it's published with CreateLensVersion.

Lenses are defined in JSON. For more information, see JSON format specification in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.

A custom lens cannot exceed 500 KB in size.

Disclaimer

Do not include or gather personal identifiable information (PII) of end users or other identifiable individuals in or via your custom lenses. If your custom lens or those shared with you and used in your account do include or collect PII you are responsible for: ensuring that the included PII is processed in accordance with applicable law, providing adequate privacy notices, and obtaining necessary consents for processing such data.

ListAnswers.name: ListAnswers
ListAnswers.documentation: List of answers for a particular workload and lens.

ListCheckDetails.name: ListCheckDetails
ListCheckDetails.documentation: List of Trusted Advisor check details by account related to the workload.

ListCheckSummaries.name: ListCheckSummaries
ListCheckSummaries.documentation: List of Trusted Advisor checks summarized for all accounts related to the workload.

ListLensReviewImprovements.name: ListLensReviewImprovements
ListLensReviewImprovements.documentation: List the improvements of a particular lens review.

ListLensReviews.name: ListLensReviews
ListLensReviews.documentation: List lens reviews for a particular workload.

ListLensShares.name: ListLensShares
ListLensShares.documentation: List the lens shares associated with the lens.

ListMilestones.name: ListMilestones
ListMilestones.documentation: List all milestones for an existing workload.

ListReviewTemplateAnswers.name: ListReviewTemplateAnswers
ListReviewTemplateAnswers.documentation: List the answers of a review template.

ListShareInvitations.name: ListShareInvitations
ListShareInvitations.documentation:
List the share invitations.

WorkloadNamePrefix, LensNamePrefix, ProfileNamePrefix, and TemplateNamePrefix are mutually exclusive. Use the parameter that matches your ShareResourceType.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation:
List the tags for a resource.

The WorkloadArn parameter can be a workload ARN, a custom lens ARN, a profile ARN, or review template ARN.

ListWorkloadShares.name: ListWorkloadShares
ListWorkloadShares.documentation: List the workload shares associated with the workload.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation:
Adds one or more tags to the specified resource.

The WorkloadArn parameter can be a workload ARN, a custom lens ARN, a profile ARN, or review template ARN.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation:
Deletes specified tags from a resource.

The WorkloadArn parameter can be a workload ARN, a custom lens ARN, a profile ARN, or review template ARN.

To specify multiple tags, use separate tagKeys parameters, for example:

DELETE /tags/WorkloadArn?tagKeys=key1&tagKeys=key2

UpdateAnswer.name: UpdateAnswer
UpdateAnswer.documentation: Update the answer to a specific question in a workload review.

UpdateGlobalSettings.name: UpdateGlobalSettings
UpdateGlobalSettings.documentation: Update whether the Amazon Web Services account is opted into organization sharing and discovery integration features.

UpdateLensReview.name: UpdateLensReview
UpdateLensReview.documentation: Update lens review for a particular workload.

UpdateReviewTemplateLensReview.name: UpdateReviewTemplateLensReview
UpdateReviewTemplateLensReview.documentation: Update a lens review associated with a review template.

UpdateShareInvitation.name: UpdateShareInvitation
UpdateShareInvitation.documentation:
Update a workload or custom lens share invitation.

This API operation can be called independently of any resource. Previous documentation implied that a workload ARN must be specified.

UpgradeLensReview.name: UpgradeLensReview
UpgradeLensReview.documentation: Upgrade lens review for a particular workload.

UpgradeReviewTemplateLensReview.name: UpgradeReviewTemplateLensReview
UpgradeReviewTemplateLensReview.documentation: Upgrade the lens review of a review template.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: User does not have sufficient access to perform this action.

JiraProjectKey.documentation: Account-level: Jira project key to sync workloads to.

IntegrationStatus.documentation: Account-level: Configuration status of the Jira integration.
Account-level: Configuration status of the Jira integration.

JiraProjectKey.documentation: Account-level: Jira project key to sync workloads to.

StatusMessage.documentation: Account-level: Status message on configuration of the Jira integration.

AccountJiraConfigurationOutput.documentation: Account-level: Output configuration of the Jira integration.

AccountSummary.documentation: Account summary for a Well-Architected best practice in relation to Trusted Advisor checks.

Type.documentation: Type of additional resource for a custom lens.

Content.documentation: The URLs for additional resources, either helpful resources or improvement plans, for a custom lens. Up to five additional URLs can be specified.

AdditionalResources.documentation:
The choice level additional resources for a custom lens.

This field does not apply to Amazon Web Services official lenses.

HelpfulResourceDisplayText.documentation:
The helpful resource text to be displayed for a custom lens.

This field does not apply to Amazon Web Services official lenses.

ChoiceAnswers.documentation: A list of selected choices to a question in your workload.

Reason.documentation: The reason why the question is not applicable to your workload.

AnswerSummaries.documentation: List of answer summaries of lens review in a workload.

ChoiceAnswerSummaries.documentation: A list of selected choices to a question in your workload.

Reason.documentation: The reason why a choice is non-applicable to a question in your workload.

AnswerSummary.documentation: An answer summary of a lens review in a workload.

ProfileArns.documentation: The list of profile ARNs to associate with the workload.

AwsRegion.documentation: An Amazon Web Services Region, for example, us-west-2 or ap-northeast-1.

Base64String.documentation:
The Base64-encoded string representation of a lens review report.

This data can be used to create a PDF file.

Only returned by GetConsolidatedReport when PDF format is requested.

BestPractice.documentation: A best practice, or question choice, that has been identified as a risk in this question.

Provider.documentation: Provider of the check related to the best practice.

LensArn.documentation: Well-Architected Lens ARN associated to the check.

FlaggedResources.documentation: Count of flagged resources associated to the check.

CheckDetail.documentation: Account details for a Well-Architected best practice in relation to Trusted Advisor checks.

Provider.documentation: Provider of the check related to the best practice.

LensArn.documentation: Well-Architected Lens ARN associated to the check.

HelpfulResource.documentation:
The helpful resource (both text and URL) for a particular choice.

This field only applies to custom lenses. Each choice can have only one helpful resource.

ImprovementPlan.documentation:
The improvement plan (both text and URL) for a particular choice.

This field only applies to custom lenses. Each choice can have only one improvement plan.

AdditionalResources.documentation:
The additional resources for a choice in a custom lens.

A choice can have up to two additional resources: one of type HELPFUL_RESOURCE, one of type IMPROVEMENT_PLAN, or both.

Reason.documentation: The reason why a choice is non-applicable to a question in your workload.

ChoiceAnswer.documentation: A choice that has been answered on a question in your workload.

Reason.documentation: The reason why a choice is non-applicable to a question in your workload.

ChoiceAnswerSummary.documentation: A choice summary that has been answered on a question in your workload.

DisplayText.documentation: The display text for the choice content.
The display text for the improvement plan.

Reason.documentation: The reason why a choice is non-applicable to a question in your workload.

ChoiceUpdate.documentation: A list of choices to be updated.

Choices.documentation: List of choices available for a question.

ClientRequestToken.documentation:
A unique case-sensitive string used to ensure that this request is idempotent (executes only once).

You should not reuse the same token for other requests. If you retry a request with the same client request token and the same parameters after the original request has completed successfully, the result of the original request is returned.

This token is listed as required, however, if you do not specify it, the Amazon Web Services SDKs automatically generate one for you. If you are not using the Amazon Web Services SDK or the CLI, you must provide this token or the request will fail.

ConflictException.documentation: The resource has already been processed, was deleted, or is too large.

MetricType.documentation: The metric type of a metric in the consolidated report. Currently only WORKLOAD metric types are supported.

Lenses.documentation: The metrics for the lenses in the workload.

LensesAppliedCount.documentation: The total number of lenses applied to the workload.

ConsolidatedReportMetric.documentation: A metric that contributes to the consolidated report.

Count.documentation: A non-negative integer that denotes how many.

LensVersion.documentation: The version of the lens being created.

IsMajorVersion.documentation: Set to true if this new major lens version.

Tags.documentation: The tags assigned to the review template.
The tags to be associated with the workload.

DiscoveryConfig.documentation: Well-Architected discovery configuration settings associated to the workload.

Applications.documentation: List of AppRegistry application ARNs associated to the workload.

ProfileArns.documentation: The list of profile ARNs associated with the workload.

ReviewTemplateArns.documentation: The list of review template ARNs to associate with the workload.

JiraConfiguration.documentation: Jira configuration settings when creating a workload.

LensStatus.documentation: The status of the lens to be deleted.

ProfileArns.documentation: The list of profile ARNs to disassociate from the workload.

Format.documentation:
The format of the consolidated report.

For PDF, Base64String is returned. For JSON, Metrics is returned.

IncludeSharedResources.documentation: Set to true to have shared resources included in the report.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

Metrics.documentation:
The metrics that make up the consolidated report.

Only returned when JSON format is requested.

GetLensReviewOutput.documentation: Output of a get lens review call.

GetLensReviewReportOutput.documentation: Output of a get lens review report call.

TargetLensVersion.documentation: The lens version to target a difference for.
The target lens version for the lens.

HelpfulResourceUrl.documentation:
The helpful resource URL.

For Amazon Web Services official lenses, this is the helpful resource URL for a question or choice.

For custom lenses, this is the helpful resource URL for a question and is only provided if HelpfulResourceDisplayText was specified for the question.

LensArn.documentation: The ARN for the lens that was created or updated.

ImprovementPlanUrl.documentation:
The improvement plan URL for a question in an Amazon Web Services official lenses.

This value is only available if the question has been answered.

This value does not apply to custom lenses.

ImprovementSummaries.documentation: List of improvement summaries of lens review in a workload.

ImprovementSummary.documentation: An improvement summary of a lens review in a workload.

InternalServerException.documentation: There is a problem with the Well-Architected Tool API service.

IsApplicable.documentation: Defines whether this question is applicable to a lens review.

JiraIssueUrl.documentation: The URL of the associated Jira issue.

Owner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the lens.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the share invitation.

LensAlias.documentation:
The alias of the lens.

For Amazon Web Services official lenses, this is either the lens alias, such as serverless, or the lens ARN, such as arn:aws:wellarchitected:us-east-1::lens/serverless. Note that some operations (such as ExportLens and CreateLensShare) are not permitted on Amazon Web Services official lenses.

For custom lenses, this is the lens ARN, such as arn:aws:wellarchitected:us-west-2:123456789012:lens/0123456789abcdef01234567890abcdef.

Each lens is identified by its LensSummary$LensAlias.

LensAliases.documentation:
List of lens aliases to associate or disassociate with a workload. Up to 10 lenses can be specified.

Identify a lens using its LensSummary$LensAlias.

Pillars.documentation: The metrics for the pillars in a lens.

LensMetric.documentation: A metric for a particular lens in a workload.

JiraConfiguration.documentation: Jira configuration status of the Lens review.

LensReviewSummaries.documentation: List of lens summaries of lens reviews of a workload.

LensReviewSummary.documentation: A lens review summary of a workload.

StatusMessage.documentation: Optional message to compliment the Status field.

LensSummaries.documentation: List of lens summaries of available lenses.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

CheckDetails.documentation: The details about the Trusted Advisor checks related to the Well-Architected best practice.

CheckSummaries.documentation: List of Trusted Advisor summaries related to the Well-Architected best practice.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

ListLensReviewImprovementsOutput.documentation: Output of a list lens review improvements call.

ListLensReviewsOutput.documentation: Output of a list lens reviews call.

SharedWithPrefix.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID, organization ID, or organizational unit (OU) ID with which the lens is shared.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

LensType.documentation: The type of lenses to be returned.

LensStatus.documentation: The status of lenses to be returned.

ListMilestonesInput.documentation: Input to list all milestones for a workload.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

ResourceArn.documentation:
The ARN for the related resource for the notification.

Only one of WorkloadID or ResourceARN should be specified.

NotificationSummaries.documentation: List of lens notification summaries in a workload.

SharedWithPrefix.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID, organization ID, or organizational unit (OU) ID with which the profile is shared.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

ProfileNamePrefix.documentation: An optional string added to the beginning of each profile name returned in the results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

AnswerSummaries.documentation: List of answer summaries of a lens review in a review template.

LensNamePrefix.documentation: An optional string added to the beginning of each lens name returned in the results.

ShareResourceType.documentation: The type of share invitations to be returned.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

ProfileNamePrefix.documentation: An optional string added to the beginning of each profile name returned in the results.

TemplateNamePrefix.documentation: An optional string added to the beginning of each review template name returned in the results.

ShareInvitationSummaries.documentation: List of share invitation summaries in a workload.

SharedWithPrefix.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID, organization ID, or organizational unit (OU) ID with which the profile is shared.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.

TemplateShareSummaries.documentation: A review template share summary return object.

SharedWithPrefix.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID, organization ID, or organizational unit (OU) ID with which the workload is shared.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return for this request.
The maximum number of results to return for this request.
The maximum number of results to return for this request.

MilestoneName.documentation:
The name of the milestone in a workload.

Milestone names must be unique within a workload.

MilestoneNumber.documentation:
The milestone number.

A workload can have a maximum of 100 milestones.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next set of results.

Notes.documentation:
The notes associated with the workload.

For a review template, these are the notes that will be associated with the workload when the template is applied.

DifferenceStatus.documentation: Indicates the type of change to the pillar.

PillarId.documentation:
The ID used to identify a pillar, for example, security.

A pillar is identified by its PillarReviewSummary$PillarId.

Questions.documentation: The questions that have been identified as risks in the pillar.

PillarMetric.documentation: A metric for a particular pillar in a lens.

PillarNotes.documentation:
List of pillar notes of a lens review in a workload.

For a review template, these are the notes that will be associated with the workload when the template is applied.

PillarReviewSummaries.documentation: List of pillar review summaries of lens review in a workload.

PillarReviewSummary.documentation: A pillar review summary of a lens review.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the share invitation.

DifferenceStatus.documentation: Indicates the type of change to the question.

BestPractices.documentation: The best practices, or choices, that have been identified as contributing to risk in a question.

QuestionMetric.documentation: A metric for a particular question in the pillar.

QuotaCode.documentation: Service Quotas requirement to identify originating quota.

Lenses.documentation: The lenses applied to the review template.

QuestionCounts.documentation: A count of how many total questions are answered and unanswered in the review template.

Tags.documentation: The tags assigned to the review template.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The latest status of a review template.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the template share invitation.

HelpfulResourceDisplayText.documentation:
The helpful resource text to be displayed for a custom lens.

This field does not apply to Amazon Web Services official lenses.

ChoiceAnswers.documentation: A list of selected choices to a question in your review template.

AnswerStatus.documentation: The status of whether or not this question has been answered.

Reason.documentation: The reason why the question is not applicable to your review template.

ChoiceAnswerSummaries.documentation: A list of selected choices to a question in the review template.

AnswerStatus.documentation: The status of whether or not this question has been answered.

Reason.documentation: The reason why a choice is not-applicable to a question in the review template.

PillarReviewSummaries.documentation: Pillar review summaries of a lens review.

QuestionCounts.documentation: A count of how many questions are answered and unanswered in the lens review.

ReviewTemplateLensReview.documentation: The lens review of a review template.

QuestionCounts.documentation: A count of how many questions are answered and unanswered in the requested pillar of the lens review.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The latest status of a review template.

Risk.documentation: The risk for a given workload, lens review, pillar, or question.

RiskCounts.documentation: A map from risk names to the count of how many questions have that rating.

SelectedChoices.documentation:
List of selected choice IDs in a question answer.

The values entered replace the previously selected choices.

SelectedQuestionIds.documentation: Selected question IDs in the selected pillar.

ServiceCode.documentation: Service Quotas requirement to identify originating service.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The user has reached their resource quota.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the share invitation.

ShareResourceType.documentation: The resource type of the share invitation.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the share invitation.

ShareResourceType.documentation: The resource type of the share invitation.

SharedWith.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID, organization ID, or organizational unit (OU) ID with which the workload, lens, profile, or review template is shared.

ThrottlingException.documentation: Request was denied due to request throttling.

TagKeys.documentation: A list of tag keys. Existing tags of the resource whose keys are members of this list are removed from the resource.

ChoiceUpdates.documentation: A list of choices to update on a question in your workload. The String key corresponds to the choice ID to be updated.

Reason.documentation: The reason why a question is not applicable to your workload.

UpdateLensReviewOutput.documentation: Output of a update lens review call.

ChoiceUpdates.documentation: A list of choices to be updated.

LensesToAssociate.documentation: A list of lens aliases or ARNs to apply to the review template.

LensesToDisassociate.documentation: A list of lens aliases or ARNs to unapply to the review template. The wellarchitected lens cannot be unapplied.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the share invitation.

ShareInvitation.documentation: The updated workload or custom lens share invitation.

IsReviewOwnerUpdateAcknowledged.documentation:
Flag indicating whether the workload owner has acknowledged that the Review owner field is required.

If a Review owner is not added to the workload within 60 days of acknowledgement, access to the workload is restricted until an owner is added.

DiscoveryConfig.documentation: Well-Architected discovery configuration settings to associate to the workload.

Applications.documentation: List of AppRegistry application ARNs to associate to the workload.

ValidationExceptionField.documentation: Stores information about a field passed inside a request that resulted in an exception.

ValidationExceptionFieldList.documentation: The fields that caused the error, if applicable.

ValidationExceptionFieldName.documentation: The field name for which validation failed.

ValidationExceptionReason.documentation: The reason why the request failed validation.

PillarDifferences.documentation: The differences between the base and latest versions of the lens.

VersionDifferences.documentation: The differences between the base and latest versions of the lens.

IsReviewOwnerUpdateAcknowledged.documentation:
Flag indicating whether the workload owner has acknowledged that the Review owner field is required.

If a Review owner is not added to the workload within 60 days of acknowledgement, access to the workload is restricted until an owner is added.

ShareInvitationId.documentation: The ID assigned to the share invitation.

Applications.documentation: List of AppRegistry application ARNs associated to the workload.

WorkloadAccountIds.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services account IDs associated with the workload.

WorkloadArchitecturalDesign.documentation: The URL of the architectural design for the workload.

WorkloadAwsRegions.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the workload, for example, us-east-2, or ca-central-1.

TrustedAdvisorIntegrationStatus.documentation: Discovery integration status in respect to Trusted Advisor for the workload.

WorkloadResourceDefinition.documentation:
The mode to use for identifying resources associated with the workload.

You can specify WORKLOAD_METADATA, APP_REGISTRY, or both.

WorkloadId.documentation: The ID assigned to the workload. This ID is unique within an Amazon Web Services Region.

WorkloadIndustryType.documentation:
The industry type for the workload.

If specified, must be one of the following:

  • Agriculture

  • Automobile

  • Defense

  • Design and Engineering

  • Digital Advertising

  • Education

  • Environmental Protection

  • Financial Services

  • Gaming

  • General Public Services

  • Healthcare

  • Hospitality

  • InfoTech

  • Justice and Public Safety

  • Life Sciences

  • Manufacturing

  • Media & Entertainment

  • Mining & Resources

  • Oil & Gas

  • Power & Utilities

  • Professional Services

  • Real Estate & Construction

  • Retail & Wholesale

  • Social Protection

  • Telecommunications

  • Travel, Transportation & Logistics

  • Other

JiraProjectKey.documentation: Workload-level: Jira project key to sync workloads to.
Workload-level: Jira project key to sync workloads to.

StatusMessage.documentation: Workload-level: Status message on configuration of the Jira integration.

WorkloadJiraConfigurationOutput.documentation: Workload-level: Output configuration of the Jira integration.

WorkloadLenses.documentation:
The list of lenses associated with the workload. Each lens is identified by its LensSummary$LensAlias.

If a review template that specifies lenses is applied to the workload, those lenses are applied to the workload in addition to these lenses.

WorkloadName.documentation:
The name of the workload.

The name must be unique within an account within an Amazon Web Services Region. Spaces and capitalization are ignored when checking for uniqueness.

WorkloadNamePrefix.documentation: An optional string added to the beginning of each workload name returned in the results.

WorkloadNonAwsRegions.documentation: The list of non-Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the workload.

WorkloadPillarPriorities.documentation: The priorities of the pillars, which are used to order items in the improvement plan. Each pillar is represented by its PillarReviewSummary$PillarId.

WorkloadReviewOwner.documentation: The review owner of the workload. The name, email address, or identifier for the primary group or individual that owns the workload review process.

StatusMessage.documentation: Optional message to compliment the Status field.

documentation:
Well-Architected Tool

This is the Well-Architected Tool API Reference. The WA Tool API provides programmatic access to the Well-Architected Tool in the Amazon Web Services Management Console. For information about the Well-Architected Tool, see the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.
